item.title: Applications for the CCPD Peer Career Advisor program are open!
item.description: RPI’s Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) is seeking energetic, positive, proactive students to fill Peer Career Advisor (PCA) positions. This position is $16/hour and will be assisting students with career-related topics such as resumes and cover letters, LinkedIn, and internship and job search basics. Apply by Sunday March 16!

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting: “Ready for Prime Time: How to Deploy Shiny Apps!” | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 6:00pm in AE217. Topic will be “Ready for Prime Time: How to Deploy Shiny Apps!” led by Dr. John Erickson, Director of Research Operations for the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. In this session we’ll review coding Shiny apps in R and Python, how to test apps internally on the FOCI Cluster, and how to robustly deploy with Docker and ShinyProxy.

item.title: Flesh/Flash: P. Staff reveals hidden layers behind the scan | March 12
item.description: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 6:00 PM. All are invited to Flesh/Flash: Scanning as Moving Image, a program of experimental film and open conversation with artist P. Staff at the culmination of their EMPAC residency. P. Staff reveals their current research using innovative techniques—from holographic images, thermal cameras, Lidar, and audio, to techniques inspired by afferent neurons—to generate politically charged data. Join us and discover the hidden layers behind the scan.

item.title: Quick Learn Webinar: Considering Brave Spaces vs. Safe Spaces in Discussions
item.description:
Date: Thursday, March 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - In this workshop we will look at the strategies around building brave spaces versus safe spaces and what that means in situations when in a learning environment with a group of peers discussing challenging topics. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will be presenting this workshop. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.
